properties.areaDesc: White, IN; Carroll, IN; Tippecanoe, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 13 at 6:02AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Tippecanoe River AT Oakdale Dam at Lake Freeman near Yeoman.
* from Sunday morning to Monday morning.
* At  7:30 AM Friday the flow was 1930 cfs.
* Flood flow is 13000 cfs.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood flow by Sunday morning and continue to
rise to near 13830 cfs by Sunday early afternoon.  The river will
fall below flood flow by early Monday morning.
* At 13000 cfs...Extensive lowland flooding with flows between 13,000
and 18,000 cubic feet per second.  Water at dangerous levels with a
few evacuations and minimal property damage.  Some local river
roads begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
